page.title: 09 Fruit Farming (1)
page.content: Fruit farming is the dominant form of farming in the area.We visited a typical fruit farm, Arnolds Fruit Farms.The family has been farming this area since 1880.A typical yield in recent years is 3000 tons of apples,200 tons of pears and about 50 tons of strawberries,raspberries,blackberries and loganberries.The fruit is stored after harvesting in modern cold storage units in which the atmosphere as well as the temperature is controlled.By controlling the oxygen,nitrogen and carbon dioxide, and the temperature, it is possible to keep fruit edible for up to 12 months.Each storage block can hold up to 54 tons of fruit.If you were to be shut into such a cold store,you would die within minutes.It is a safety rule that workers never enter a cold store on their own.
